flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education. Topic: Cloud Service Provider Activity Monitoring (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Investigation Types > Digital Forensics Investigation Types > Cloud Forensics > Cloud Service Provider Activity Monitoring). Use this COMPLETE research context: ## Cloud Service Provider Activity Monitoring: Comprehensive Summary CSP activity monitoring: Continuous observation/collection/analysis/reporting of events in CSP infrastructure for security/compliance. Key elements: Logging (event records: app/system/network/security), Telemetry (remote metrics/health), Auditing (compliance checks), Alerting (notifications), Incident Response (IR procedures), Continuous Monitoring (ongoing control assessment). Shared Responsibility Model: CSP secures physical infra/hypervisor; customer secures OS/apps/data/config/identity. Standards/Frameworks: - NIST SP 800-144: Guidelines on Security/Privacy in Public Cloud Computing (monitor customer data, logs from hypervisor/host). - NIST SP 800-53 Rev5: AU (Audit/Accountability: AU-2/3/6/12 logging/monitoring), SI-4 System Monitoring. - NIST SP 800-207: Zero Trust Architecture (continuous monitoring/validation, assume breach). - ISO 27017: Cloud-specific ISO 27002 (A.12.4 Logging/monitoring, A.14.2.7 event detection). - CSA CCM v4: MCC (Monitoring/Logging), AUD (Audit Logging), LOG (Logging). CSP Examples: - AWS: CloudTrail (API calls/management events, S3 delivery), CloudWatch (logs/metrics/alarms), GuardDuty (ML threats). - Azure: Azure Monitor/Log Analytics (unified logs), Sentinel (SIEM/ML), Activity Logs. - GCP: Cloud Audit Logs (Admin/Data/System activity), Cloud Monitoring/Logging, Security Command Center. Best Practices: Enable comprehensive logging, centralize (SIEM), retain 90-365 days, encrypt, integrate IR/Zero Trust/ML anomaly. Sources: https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/Legacy/SP/nistspecialpublication800-144.pdf (SP800-144), https://csrc.nist.gov/pubs/sp/800/53/r5/upd1/final (SP800-53), https://nvlpubs.nist.gov/nistpubs/SpecialPublications/NIST.SP.800-207.pdf (SP800-207), https://www.iso.org/standard/43757.html (ISO27017), https://cloudsecurityalliance.org/artifacts/cloud-controls-matrix-v4/ (CSA CCM), AWS Docs: https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cloudtrail/latest/userguide/cloudtrail-user-guide.html, Azure: https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/, GCP: https://cloud.google.com/logging/docs/audit. Prior Knowledge: Logging/auditing basics, shared responsibility, Digital Forensics (evidence handling). Incorporate: Learning objectives [paste array above], Active learning [reference for question inspiration], Scaffolding [paste 4 layers]. Generate EXACTLY 25 flashcards in VALID JSON ARRAY ONLY. No markdown/extra text. Follow schema precisely: each item has question (MCQ), correct_answer, explanation, distractors (EXACTLY 3: {text, explanation}), bloom_level (enum), scaffolding_layer (1-4). Cover all objectives/layers evenly. Questions from research only. Distractors plausible (e.g., swap NIST pubs, confuse AWS services). Ensure JSON parsable (escape strings).
